Author: mov
Content:
Please, check http://cliki.net, http://common-lisp.net and http://cl-user.net. There are packages to all the things commented.

About SQL, for example, I'm using Submarine (ORM) with Postmodern and it's running like a charm. For Web development, there are Hunchentoot, AllegroServe and interesting frameworks like UCW or Weblocks (each one I'm using right now).

Maybe the guy didn't tried enough, more 5 min. at google would be enough ;-)

Author: henning
Content:
Lush is great for numerical prototyping, much better than MATLAB/Octave. Its matrix/tensor engine is one of the most awesome (as in being in awe) pieces of software I've ever come across. It is definitely mature and well-tested in that niche. It was created by leading neural network researchers.

Outside of its niche, it's pretty useless.

Author: mynameishere
Content:
Would we feel proud of living off of a business model that targets the poor?

Sloppy. He doesn't make a hard distinction between gray-area fraudulent "sweepstakes" ads and legitimate ads. The above quote makes it sound like selling products/services to the poor is somehow wrong...obviously false. If the sweepstakes ads are clicked on by poor people more often than rich people, well, that's not a big surprise, but it has nothing to do with advertising in general.

Author: nradov
Content: Economists have studied this as signalling in the labor market.\nhttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Signalling_%28economics%29#The_...\nBasically, employees tend to get more education than they really need just as a way to stand out from the crowd and signal their value to employers.
